intro: Knautia integrifolia var. urvillei, commonly known as Urville's knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant features finely divided, lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
